isis.stitle: TSI 01-03-01 - Ride Quality Improvement for 3400, 4700 and 4700LP/LPX Models with 8000 Lb. Parabolic Spring Front Suspension, Codes 003AAN, 003ADA and 003AEM and Rear Air Suspensions

subjectgroup.subject: Ride Quality Improvement for 3400, 4700 and 4700LP/LPX Models with 8000 Lb. Parabolic Spring Front Suspension, Codes 003AAN, 003ADA and 003AEM and Rear Air Suspensions

geninfo.para: Improved ride quality can be achieved on 3400, 4700 and 4700LP/LPX Models with 8000 Lb. parabolic spring front suspensions and rear air suspensions having a 9.5 inch ride height as noted on the lineset (12.5 inch air spring height ).

item.para: Many chassis are lightly loaded and tire pressure, particularly drive tire pressure, can be reduced considerably from the maximum cold inflation pressure, indicated on the tire side wall, to match actual tire loading. This will improve ride quality significantly. Refer to the Tire Load/ Inflation Charts in Service Manual S17001Y, found in Group 17 in the Master Service Manual.

Beginning in July, 1999, 19.5 inch tires and rims are matched mounted. The tire high spot is assembled to match the rim/ wheel low spot yielding a more uniform round assembly. Tire and wheel assembly radial runout exceeding .045 inch total runout, particularly on steer axles, can cause undesirable chassis vibration at certain speeds in the normal driving range. Tire and wheel assembly runout should be verified when low frequency ride vibration is experienced at road speeds near 60 MPH on a smooth black top road surface.
Beginning April, 2001, chassis with air brakes are equipped with dual step piloted brake drums that assure drum/wheel assembly concentricity for improved ride and brake feel.

Front steer axle shocks, calibrated and optimized for parabolic springs, softer bushings for air suspension torque rods, and a lower spring rate air spring rated at 15,500 pounds for rear axle suspensions (excluding 4700LPX) are available in Service Parts and will improve ride quality.

entry.para: Shock Absorber, for 8000 Lb. Parabolic Spring Front Suspension
Torque Rod, for Rear Air Suspension
Suspension Air Spring, for 9.5 Inch Ride Height, 12.5 Inch Air Spring Height (excluding LPX)

step1.para: Weigh the vehicle with a typical load. Record the weight at each axle. Refer to the Service Load and Inflation Charts in Service Section S17001Y in Group 17 of the Master Service Manual and match the cold inflation pressure to the maximum loads actually being carried. This will optimize the tire, relative to ride, and soften ride harshness.

If vehicle vibration is being experienced at a certain road speed, and the vibration diminishes or disappears above or below that road speed, the tire and wheel assembly runout, exceeding .045 inch total runout, is the likely cause particularly on the steer axle.

warning.para: A jack must never be used alone to support a vehicle while chassis service is being performed. The jack may lower and serious personal injury could result. Always support the vehicle with floor stands.

item.para: Park the vehicle on a flat level surface, chock the wheels, and with a suitable jack and floor stands raise the tire and wheel assemblies so that the tire is not in contact with the ground. Measure for runout exceeding .045 inch total runout. To decrease the runout, mark the tire relative to wheel rim position, disassemble the tire and wheel assembly, rotate the tire 180° relative to the wheel and re-assemble.

note.para: On steel wheels, the rim low spot is marked with a blunt 1/8 inch diameter punch mark on the deep dish (soup) side, the side visible on the rear outer dual with 22.5/24.5 inch wheels. 19.5 inch wheels may be marked on either side of the wheel near the tire bead seat and may be covered by the mounted tire. On aluminum wheels, the tire high point is mounted next to the valve stem.

item.para: If the vehicle ride quality needs to be improved further, consider replacing the front suspension shock absorbers, rear air suspension torque rods and rear suspension air springs depending on the vehicle suspension configuration.
